page.title: 02CLUBS..RECREATION
page.content: In Kelty, there are clubs for people of all ages, such as guides, brownies for girls and scouts, boys brigade for boys. Boys and girls also enjoy a pony club, a karate club and toddlers group. Adults of all ages enjoy a varied club life, from Kelty Hearts Junior Football to flourishing bowling club. There are billiards, snooker and a draughts club which produced a world champion, Robert Stewart in 1922 - 37. There is a well - attended old - age pensioners club established at the Moray Institute. There are ladies guilds and clubs attached to various bodies throughout the community.
